nodes.text: The Democratic-controlled Senate confirmed 80 judges in its first 15 months in power - more than the Republican-led Senate confirmed in its final 30 months in control from 1999 through the summer of 2001.
In a speech that appears to have been timed for the upcoming elections President Bush attacked the Senate this week for having a  lousy record  of confirming his judicial nominees.
Only if the facts are true the attack has a sense
The facts do not bear this out.
Only if the number of confirmed judges is inferior to anyother it can be defined  lousy record
